description: Example configurations for live data feeds

binance_example.description: Binance crypto data with WebSocket real-time updates (public data only)

yahoo_example.description: Yahoo Finance stock data with polling updates

ibkr_example.description: IBKR data with native API real-time updates

usage_example.python_code:
from src.data.data_feed_factory import DataFeedFactory
import json

# Load configuration
with open('config/trading/live_data_example.json', 'r') as f:
    config = json.load(f)

# Create data feed
feed_config = config['data_feeds']['binance_example']
data_feed = DataFeedFactory.create_data_feed(feed_config)

# Use with Backtrader
cerebro = bt.Cerebro()
cerebro.adddata(data_feed)
cerebro.run()

notes.api_keys: This configuration uses public data only. No API keys required for basic functionality.
notes.rate_limits: Be aware of rate limits for each data source
notes.connection: Ensure proper network connectivity for real-time data
notes.testing: Use testnet/paper trading first before live trading
notes.binance_public: Binance public data includes OHLCV data for all trading pairs
notes.yahoo_public: Yahoo Finance provides free stock and ETF data
notes.ibkr_connection: IBKR requires TWS or Gateway to be running for data access
